name: Eliud Khayo
title: Director & Head of Operations
expertise: PhD Economist specializing in health economics and statistical analysis
summary: Eliud brings extensive expertise in economics research and operations management. With a PhD in Economics and advanced skills in statistical analysis, he leads operational excellence and strategic economic initiatives for Lesar Consults.
contributions: Led economic impact assessments for major healthcare initiatives
Developed statistical frameworks for policy evaluation
Streamlined operational processes improving efficiency by 40%
Published research on healthcare economics in peer-reviewed journals

name: Japheth Athanasio
title: Director & CEO
expertise: PhD Candidate in Health Systems Strengthening & Financing
summary: Japheth is a visionary leader with deep expertise in health systems strengthening and financing. As CEO, he guides Lesar Consults' strategic direction while maintaining hands-on involvement in critical healthcare policy and financing initiatives.
education: PhD (Candidate) in Health Systems Strengthening & Financing
MSc in Health Policy and Management
contributions: Founded Lesar Consults and grew it to a leading advisory firm
Advised on health financing reforms across multiple countries
Led strategic partnerships with international development organizations
Championed evidence-based approaches to health systems strengthening

projects.title: National Health Financing Strategy
projects.impact: Designed sustainable financing model for national health system

projects.title: Multi-Country Health Systems Assessment
projects.impact: Evaluated health systems across 8 African countries

name: Jamlick Karumbi
title: Lead Consultant, Epidemiologist
expertise: PhD Epidemiologist with expertise in disease surveillance and public health research
summary: Jamlick is a seasoned epidemiologist with a PhD and extensive experience in disease surveillance, outbreak investigation, and public health research. He leads epidemiological studies and provides technical expertise on health security initiatives.
contributions: Led epidemiological investigations for major disease outbreaks
Developed surveillance systems for infectious disease monitoring
Published extensively on epidemiological methods and findings
Trained public health professionals across the region

projects.title: Regional Disease Surveillance System
projects.impact: Enhanced early warning capabilities across 12 health facilities

name: Wairimu Maina
title: Lead Consultant, Economist & Financial Analyst
expertise: Senior economist specializing in financial analysis and economic policy
summary: Wairimu is a distinguished economist and financial analyst with deep expertise in economic policy analysis, financial modeling, and development economics. She leads economic assessments and provides strategic financial guidance for complex development projects.
contributions: Conducted economic impact assessments for major infrastructure projects
Developed financial models for sustainable development initiatives
Advised on economic policy reforms and fiscal strategies
Led cost-benefit analyses for international development programs

name: Benjamin Mutuku
title: Lead Consultant, GIS & Spatial Analysis
expertise: GIS specialist with advanced expertise in spatial analysis and geospatial technologies
summary: Benjamin is a highly skilled GIS specialist with extensive experience in spatial analysis, mapping, and geospatial technology applications. He leads spatial analysis projects and provides technical expertise on location-based research and planning initiatives.
education: BSc in Geography and Spatial Planning
contributions: Developed GIS solutions for health facility mapping and planning
Led spatial analysis for disease distribution and risk mapping
Created interactive mapping platforms for stakeholder engagement
Trained teams on GIS applications in public health and development

projects.title: Disease Risk Mapping Platform
projects.impact: Enhanced surveillance and response planning capabilities
